intro: Dichromena tenella, commonly known as the slender dichromena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Dichromena tenella is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
